author: mikemaccana
body:
Windows 10, build 6.2.9200.0.

Try and associate a file type with a Powershell script.

Right click a file, pick 'Open With'.  `.bat` and `.cmd` files are included as 'Programs'. `ps1` is not.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172594/35052408-68f4def8-fb9f-11e7-9d78-bd02ca47cbec.png)

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: @mikemaccana PowerShell were never included in the open with list in windows and PowerShell core has nothing to do with this. You could probably give feedback via User voice for Windows [https://wpdev.uservoice.com/forums/110705-universal-windows-platform](url)

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
> PowerShell were never included in the open with list in windows 

Yes, hence creating this bug to fix it.

> You could probably give feedback via User voice for Windows 

I would have thought so too, but [Steve Lee, Principle Software Engineer for Powershell, asked me to file it as an issue in this repository](https://twitter.com/Steve_MSFT/status/953341246747025408).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Close as stale issue. Feel free to continue discussion.

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body: @iSazonov still occurs in Windows 10 build 210108. What should I do to get it fixed?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @mikemaccana I guess it is Windows _security_ design. You will also not find VBS on this list. You could discuss this in a more appropriate security forum. (I'm not even sure if this can be configured.)

title: Powershell scripts are not recognised as a 'Program' for 'Open with' screen. Only .cmd, and .bat are.
